intro: Ossaea semijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Ossaea semijuga is notable for its resilience to drought and its role in stabilizing coastal and inland sand dunes.
